channel.title: Summary :: Introduction to Python
channel.description: In this lab, we covered several major important topics. Letâ€™s quickly review them. Data Types in Python str data type stores text (strings). Use str(expression) to convert an expression to a string if possible. int data type stores whole numbers (integers). Use int(expression) to convert an expression to an integer if possible. float data type stored decimal numbers (floating-point). Use float(expression) to convert an expression to a floating-point value, if possible.
